description: Identify a baseline VM capacity metric of the system under test using a time-varying load profile.

test_properties.description: Enable thresholds on CPU performance.
Enable thresholds on memory performance.
Enable thresholds on network performance.
Enable thresholds on storage performance.
The minimum time to generate load on the selected agents.
Initial instance count per template to apply to the binary search algorithm.
The minimum instance count per template to apply to the binary search algorithm.
The maximum instance count per template to apply to the binary search algorithm.
If the difference between the highest passing iteration and lowest failing iteration is less than the resolution, the search algorithm will stop.
Time to wait after stopping agents before collecting results and validating the iteration.
JSON file containing the recorded time varying load profile data.  All time varying load profiles referenced by TVLP ID must be defined in this file.
Maximum amount of time to wait for a response from the provider when a command is issued.
Amount of time to wait between polls to check for the provider's response to a command.

Maximum amount of time to wait for auto-deployed agents to come up.  This maximum applies to agents of a specific Template or a specific batch of agents on a specific Template if BatchSize is non-zero.

Amount of time to wait between polls to check for the number of agents have successfully been deployed for a specific Template or a specific batch of agents on a specific Template if BatchSize is non-zero.

Specifies the maximum time in seconds to wait to for all the deployed agents of the Template to be torn down.  When the BatchSize is non-zero, this parameter corresponds to the maximum wait time per batch of agents per Template.

Specifies the time in milliseconds to wait between polls while polling for number of agents that are still up.  Note that each poll for number of agents that are up involves issuing a command to the provider to get the current number of agents that are still up.

Maximum number of agents to attempt at any one time.  Note that the Templates are deployed serially; the BatchSize further breaks up the agents in a Template to reduce the load on the server.  Set the BatchSize to zero to deploy all agents on a Template as fast as possible.

Maximum number of agents to attempt at any one time.  Note that the Templates are deployed serially; the BatchSize further breaks up the agents in a Template to reduce the load on the server.  Set the BatchSize to zero to tear down all agents on a Template as fast as possible.

test_properties.display_name: Enable Delete Instances On End Of Test
test_properties.description: Enable deletion of all auto-deployed instances at the end of the test.
The time-varying load profile parameters to apply to all instances.

column_definitions.description: Specifies the ID referencing a time-varying load profile to use for generating load.
The resource ID of the template model these parameters are for. An empty string indicates to apply to all template models.

The resource ID of the node within the specified template model these parameters is for. An empty string indicates to apply to all nodes within the template model. If TemplateId is empty string, this is treated as an empty string.
The name of the node within the specified template model that this load profile applies to.  When Node ID is an empty string, this field is ignored.
The name of this load profile.

test_properties.description: The maximum acceptable difference between the intended CPU load and actual CPU load for each agent.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the actual load is within the allowed variance.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable variance.
The acceptable variance between the intended memory read rate and actual memory read rate.
The maximum acceptable latency, in nanoseconds, of memory read operations.
The acceptable variance between the intended memory write rate and actual memory write rate.
The maximum acceptable latency, in nanoseconds, of memory write operations.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the actual load is within the acceptable variance.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable variance.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the measured latency is acceptable.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable latency.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the actual load is within the acceptable variance.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable variance.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the measured latency is acceptable.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable latency.
The acceptable variance between the intended network read rate and actual network read rate.
The maximum acceptable latency, in nanoseconds, of network read operations.
The acceptable variance between the intended network write rate and actual network write rate.
The maximum acceptable latency, in nanoseconds, of network write operations.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the actual load is within the acceptable variance.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable variance.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the measured latency is acceptable.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable latency.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the actual load is within the acceptable variance.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable variance.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the measured latency is acceptable.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable latency.
The acceptable variance between the intended storage read rate and actual storage read rate.
The maximum acceptable latency, in nanoseconds, of storage read operations.
The acceptable variance between the intended storage write rate and actual storage write rate.
The maximum acceptable latency, in nanoseconds, of storage write operations.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the actual load is within the acceptable variance.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable variance.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the measured latency is acceptable.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable latency.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the actual load is within the acceptable variance.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable variance.

The number of result samples as a percentage of the total result samples from data from up to the five worst performing agents per dimension that show the measured latency is acceptable.  Agents are ranked according to how many result samples do not meet acceptable latency.
